metadata.title: CVE-2017-13168 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability in the kernel scsi driver. Product:Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID A-65023233.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-lowlatency - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1095.103
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1099.104
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-aws - 4.4.0-1066.76
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-39-generic - 4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-39-lowlatency - 4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-39-generic - 4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-39-lowlatency - 4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1031-azure - 4.15.0-1031.32~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1024-gcp - 4.15.0-1024.25~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-kvm - 4.4.0-1032.38
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1017.22~recert1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1017.22~recert1

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-134.160').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.103').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.104').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.76').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.32~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1024.25~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.38').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
